title: No one honors the support.
body:
Literally,

Well I am a Soraka main for this week, I Cure, zone / silence, Ward the bushes, facecheck when none tank exist, I use my items to protect or buff my teamates, shotcall the drake or baron when we got some kills (usually the jungler),  in almost every game I come to heal much more than the damage that my own carrys, and in a bad game (usually vs ignite or burstdamage guys) the same amount as my carry do (because i build solaris first, to shield them), but still I dont have reach a 3 honors game, no medal for this honor, sometimes a ungrateful scumb of elo give me  0 honor and everyone of my teamates are lower rank than me, they dont aprecciate the arden censer buff , they only say "GJ Ashe" , "Vayne is broken", they dont see who use all the items and spells and sometime die from bleeding his own health for they to survive a bite from the Cho, ohhhh what a ungrateful scumb of elo,

 I demand u to salute with a "hail support" that carry ur dirty ass from the ground, and kiss my paw until my horn blows when the victory screen comes.

This day , take a slow motion moment to aprecciate ur support in your dirty clown fiesta, yees a clown dam fiesta  because u are low elo. 

He will thank you saving your kda.

replies.body:
As support, you have to kiss ass all game, make sick plays, and have an assist count in the 20s before someone will honor you. 

As ADC, you can be the biggest dick on earth, if you carried, you get a hat-trick.

Depends on the champ.  Notice others responding talking about  Leo, Thresh, and Rakan.  Gotta have a play maker like that (Blitz, Bard also work) and then make a play or two.  Not saying you can't get honor on traditional supps, but you still gotta make a play noticeable.  The other day, I got a Janna shield on our jg Rengar who was basically carrying, as he was running out of the enemy base with like 10 life.  I saved him from an aa or a minion or something with a quick shield, and he was super grateful.  I think I got my 1 honor from him for that one play.

Other times, I just set up my adc several times with a CCer like zyra, morg or nami and i get honor from them.

Basically, you have to stand out and  your 0-0-40 stat line isn't going to impress if your carry is 15-4-10.  K is worth like 5x A in most people's eyes. 

SO, make plays.

In essence, your theory is correct....harder to get honor on support, you really need to stand out, but it is very possible.  I prob get honor in 3/4 games.  Once in awhile I get 2.  Think I got 3 once.

Well, technically the kill _is_ worth about 2 assists in most cases. Up to 4 assists can be obtained per kill. The assists can be gained from a single auto-attack or dealing 90% of the enemy's HP or by applying a small slow, or by stunlocking them to death. There's a lot of variation—in some cases, the assist is pretty much worthless, while in others the assist is worth much more than the kill, but I notice that in teamfights assists pop up everywhere without necessarily actually meaning anything.

So, 0/0/40 as a support is still better than 15/4/10 in most people's eyes, but the real difference comes down to, _how well_ did you actually play as _support_? Do you have good warding? Good pings to tell people to back off for incoming ganks? Did you make calls on objectives? Were you there for every teamfight, making a difference with your CC, shields, and/or healing?

I've noticed that both good supports and bad supports can get a score like that, and the good ones will always get honors, while the bad ones almost never do. If you're not actually contributing anything other than the occasional auto to grab those assists, nobody will enjoy your "assistance". It just comes down to your perceived impact—saving someone will mean a lot.

As a burst mage support, I often have the highest damage in the game. But if I'm not actively _supporting_ rather than racking up the damage and kills, people don't want me on their teams. That's the difference between a good Lux support and a bad one—you _must_ have more impact than just assists and kills. The same goes for the carries—if they just pick up kills with one last auto, people will recognize that they aren't actually contributing, so they won't be getting honored either.

I guess I agree with you, but the way you addressed the kill/assist difference seemed somewhat dismissive, though there's some truth in that perception. Sure, it's inflated, but that doesn't mean it's not legitimate in some ways.

I don't think I'm being dismissive of assists at all.  I don't recall a single post game chat where a teammate said...."OMG look at all those assists our supp had."  The only time people make a big deal about assists is when they have too many and they aren't supp. "OMG, guess I'm supporting this game," says the 1-1-8 ADC.

I had a 3-4-32 Nami game yesterday...bubbling this and that, healing everyone, helping them escape with my passive.  No honor, no comments.  SO even sometimes when making plays, there's no honor....even with 32 assists.

BTW, people don't care about warding and other supp duties.  They are glad it's there and miss certain things when it's not, but again, never have I had anyone congratulate me on my vision score, which is stellar.

You misunderstood. I felt like you were dismissive of the perception that assists are worth significantly less than kills. Many people, as you said, seem to think it's 1 kill = 4-5 assists. But there's some truth in that; as a support main, I'd estimate 1 kill = about 2 assists.

I think it's more about the pinging, which you can only do if you have those wards down. If you ping someone to fall back when a gank is incoming, and they listen, they'll be appreciative when they survive. Usually.

oh... haha.  no.  i think we are on the same page, just misread each other.

anyway, a side note.  i think the team mates you get come into play ofc.  i just had a similar nami game.  i didnt carry, but i was all over the place, helping out team mates and i got 3 honors.  so each game will have its own honor even if you perform the same exact way.
If they're good, then I usually favor the support when honoring.
When I play with my friends (4 man premade) we only go for ARAM. If the random gets a support/straight up healer like Soraka we will ALWAYS honor the support/healer.
The new honor system is pretty toxic tbh famalam.

That's because Soraka isn't noticeable to get your teams attention. The role of healer isn't the best play maker. It's like when you have a very well played Leona or Thresh; the visual is very easy to see. You notice their playmaking. With Soraka she's just a heal bot that mostly goes unappreciated. Also when Soraka does well, it means everyone else is doing well. So the carry that was largely supported by Soraka gets honoured instead.
Just had enemy thresh as most honored player last game. Play well and you get honored.
You aren't getting honor just for existing as a support, you have to earn it. I have honored plenty of Janna, Soraka, Nami players for making good calls, plays, etc.
I honor good supports, and I have seen Supports overwhelmingly get the most honor on a team in nearly all my games.  Are you a bad support?
If you play support for the intended glory, then you are doing it for the wrong reason.
You're honoured based on sportsmanship or shotcalling. That's your reward. If you want a reward for playing well you likely win the game.
Yes they do. I hate it when people spam this junk, makes me feel like a bloody dingus.
I get honors all the time. you just need to spam laugh more.
I played Bard 2 days ago and got 3 honors. Maybe you are a bad support...
What? Supports get by far the most honor, when I play Thresh my chance of getting 3 honors is much higher than with anything else.
idk, i normally recieve the most honors and all i really play is rakan sup
